result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaha K Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 1/2 years bifurcated sentence.
STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Comply with rules and regulations of supervising agent.  Engage in a recovery program.  Report to Racine Vocational Ministry for programming.  Comply with mental health assessment and follow through with recommendations.  Engage in grief counseling and/or therapy.  Obtain valid driver's license.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  No contact with the victim, TLS (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
